column4: Hey guys.  I just fresh-installed Kubuntu and for some reason, when I type :help in vim, it says "No tags file" "Sorry, no help for help.txt".  Whawt gives?
Is there a KDE equivalent of that, or will KDE just play nice with vim-full?
there are no vim UIs not written in gtk. you don't need vim-full, i installed it and never use the GUI version
You mean, there are no Vim UIs written in Qt?
BTW, installing vim-full worked like a dream.
they are pointless, they just slow the workflow down
I've been using Vim for 5 years, dude.  Trust me, I know
I just wanted the help files
I'm not entirely sure how I got sidetracked into the GUI discussion
so avoid those nasty UIs! :p yeah. i had the same issue, that's why i suggested vim-full. it does the gnome UI crap but just don't use it
i wish there was a vim-full-nogui package ;)
looks like "sudo apt-get install vim vim-common" might do the trick minus the GUI stuff
hmmm, well, I already have vim-full
yeah, same here, just saying if you really want to get rid of vim-full and the gui related packages, you could go that route. personally, i'd just leave it as is :p
